pinyin: yi1 ju1 tong2 qing2 zhi1 lei4

sentences.english: There is no man but feels (ie no man who does not feel) pity for starving children.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人不同情那些嗷嗷待哺的孩子。

sentences.english: I pity the fool who's illogic.
sentences.chinese: 我同情那些沒有邏輯的傻瓜。

sentences.english: What if Love and Compassion Win?
sentences.chinese: 如果關愛和同情獲勝會怎樣？

sentences.english: The doctor watched the patient sympathetically.
sentences.chinese: 醫生同情地注視着病人。

sentences.english: You lean upon a broken reed, if you trust to their compassion.
sentences.chinese: 你若是指望他們的同情，那你就等於倚在破葦杆上。

sentences.english: I commiserated the people who misdoubt the love because of they were never experienced.
sentences.chinese: 我同情不相信愛情的人，因爲他們不曾經歷過。

sentences.english: For human-rights activists and sympathizers of the Dalai Lama in Western countries, their actions can be called a failure.
sentences.chinese: 人權份子和西方噠賴的同情者們的舉動是失敗的。

sentences.english: It would be better if he simply lent a sympathetic ear.
sentences.chinese: 其實他們只要支着耳朵同情地傾聽就行了。
同情的淚水潤溼了我的雙頰。

sentences.english: Victoria always kept sympathies for the Romanovs in her heart.
sentences.chinese: 維多利亞一向同情羅曼諾夫在她心中。

sentences.english: But the government, at least initially, sympathised with those protests.
sentences.chinese: 不過政府至少在最初階段是同情那些抗議的。

sentences.english: Reading is not merely sympathizing and understand; it is also criticizing and judging.
sentences.chinese: 閱讀不僅是同情與瞭解，也是批評與判斷。

sentences.english: Its pleadings will not bear to be stereotyped.
sentences.chinese: 它的訴諸同情的方法不能一成不變。

sentences.english: Yang Ming learned that the story of the blue Ling, he began to sympathize with the blue ling.
sentences.chinese: 楊明得知藍凌的身世，他開始同情起藍凌。

sentences.english: The Brazilian government also offered condolences and sympathies to the Chinese government and people.
sentences.chinese: 巴西政府向中國政府和人民表示同情和慰問。
我們對落敗者表示同情。

definition: to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to take pity on/to feel tenderness toward
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to regret/to feel that it is a great pity/to feel sorry for sb
to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful
guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
